message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The graph provided shows the change in forced expiratory volume before and after administration of albuterol. A 12% or greater improvement in forced expiratory volume indicates a reversible obstructive pulmonary condition. Therefore, the correct answer is (A).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The graph shows the forced expiratory volume before and after the administration of inhaled albuterol. The percentage change in the expiratory volume is calculated by (post-albuterol volume - pre-albuterol volume)/pre-albuterol volume x 100. A reversible obstructive pulmonary condition is indicated by an improvement of 12% or more. Therefore, the correct answer is (A).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The graph shows the percentage change in forced expiratory volume (FEV1) before and after the administration of inhaled albuterol. A reversible obstructive pulmonary condition will have a significant improvement in FEV1 after albuterol and a cutoff of 12% or greater is used to diagnose asthma. Therefore, the correct answer is (A).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The graph shows the percentage change in forced expiratory volume (FEV1) before and after the administration of albuterol. An increase of 12% or more in FEV1 after albuterol indicates a reversible obstructive pulmonary condition. Option (B) is too low of a percentage to indicate reversible obstruction, options (C) and (D) are too high.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The graph shows a significant improvement (12%) in forced expiratory volume after using inhaled albuterol. A reversible obstructive pulmonary condition is diagnosed when there is at least a 12% improvement in forced expiratory volume. Therefore, the correct answer is (A).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The graph shows the percentage change in forced expiratory volume (FEV1) before and after the administration of inhaled albuterol. A reversible obstructive pulmonary condition is indicated by a change of at least 12% in FEV1. Therefore, the correct answer is (A).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The graph shows the pre- and post-albuterol forced expiratory volume (FEV) values. A 12% increase in FEV1 (forced expiratory volume in one second) indicates a significant response to bronchodilators and suggests a reversible obstructive pulmonary condition. Option B (9%) is too small to be clinically significant. Option C (50%) and D (75%) are too high and suggest a fixed obstruction rather than a reversible one.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A reversible obstructive pulmonary condition is characterized by an increase in forced expiratory volume (FEV1) after the administration of bronchodilator. A change of 12% or higher is considered significant and indicative of a reversible condition. Therefore, option (A) is the correct answer. Options (B), (C), and (D) are incorrect as they suggest lower percentage changes, which would not be indicative of reversible obstructive pulmonary condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The graph shows the before and after lung function test results after administering albuterol. A reversible obstructive pulmonary condition is indicated when there is an increase in the forced expiratory volume after administering albuterol. A 12% increase in expiratory volume indicates a reversible obstructive pulmonary condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The graph shows that the patient’s forced expiratory volume improved by 12% after the administration of inhaled albuterol. A reversible obstructive pulmonary condition is indicated by an improvement of at least 12% in forced expiratory volume after bronchodilator administration. Therefore, the correct answer is (A).
